titleStmt.title: The great and wonderful success and vertues of Clark's compound spirits of scurvey-grass (both golden and plain) in curing many languishing and grievous distempers. Faithfully prepared (by his widow) according to his own directions.
titleStmt.author: Clark, Mary, fl. 1685-1700.

notesStmt.note: Item at reel position E8:2[63] imperfect: some staining and fading.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
